title: Requires the prior approval of the appropriate legislative committees required of agency rules and regulations
summary: Requires state agencies to submit proposed rules and regulations intended to implement legislation to the appropriate committee of the legislature for approval; provides that no such rule or regulation shall take effect unless it has been approved by a majority vote of such legislative committee.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

       Introduced  by  M. of A. TEDISCO -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. KOLB,
         OAKS, RAIA -- read once and referred to the Committee on  Governmental
         Operations

       AN  ACT  to amend the state administrative procedure act, in relation to
         legislative approval of certain proposed rules

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The state administrative procedure act is amended by adding
    2  a new section 202-f to read as follows:
    3     S  202-F. LEGISLATIVE APPROVAL. IN ADDITION TO THE PROCEDURE REQUIRED
    4  PURSUANT TO SECTION TWO HUNDRED TWO OF THIS ARTICLE  AND  PRIOR  TO  THE
    5  HOLDING  OF A  PUBLIC HEARING, AN AGENCY SHALL SUBMIT ANY PROPOSED RULE,
    6  INTENDED TO IMPLEMENT LEGISLATION, TO THE APPROPRIATE COMMITTEES OF  THE
    7  SENATE  AND ASSEMBLY HAVING JURISDICTION OF THE SUBJECT MATTER FOR THEIR
    8  APPROVAL. NO SUCH RULE SHALL TAKE EFFECT UNLESS IT HAS BEEN APPROVED  BY
    9  A MAJORITY VOTE OF EACH COMMITTEE TO WHICH IT HAS BEEN REFERRED.
   10     S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02225-01-1
